solution_line_template: First Jamie wants to figure out how many calories his father needs to lose from {pounds_to_lose} pounds x {calories_per_pound} calories each = <<{pounds_to_lose}*{calories_per_pound}={total_calories_to_burn}>>{total_calories_to_burn} calories to burn off.

Then Jamie needs to figure out how many calories his father will burn per day if he burns {calories_burned_daily} calories - eating {calories_eaten_daily} calories = burning <<{calories_burned_daily}-{calories_eaten_daily}={net_calories_burned_per_day}>>{net_calories_burned_per_day} calories a day.

If Jamie's father wants to burn off {total_calories_to_burn} calories total at {net_calories_burned_per_day} calories a day, {total_calories_to_burn} / {net_calories_burned_per_day} = <<{total_calories_to_burn}/{net_calories_burned_per_day}={days_to_burn_off_fat}>>{days_to_burn_off_fat} days to burn off 5 pounds.
